data.enText: a powerful illegal drug that affects the mind in a harmful way. Heroin and cocaine are narcotics .
a narcotics agent (= a police officer investigating the illegal trade in drugs)

data.chText: 麻醉性镇痛药；镇静剂；麻醉药
data.enText: a substance that relaxes you, reduces pain or makes you sleep
that affects your mind in a harmful way

simple_means.memory_skill: narco 麻木 + tic 有…性质的 → 麻醉的

tr: a drug that produces numbness or stupor
often taken for pleasure or to reduce pain
extensive use can lead to addiction
of or relating to or designating narcotics

value.def: Narcotics are drugs such as opium or heroin which make you sleepy and stop you feeling pain. You can also use narcotics, especially in American English, to mean any kind of illegal drug.

example.ex: He was indicted for dealing in narcotics...
example.tran: 他因从事毒品交易被起诉。

example.ex: He appears to be high on some sort of narcotic.
example.tran: 他看起来飘飘欲仙，像是吸食了某种毒品。

value.tran: 致幻毒品;麻醉品;(泛指)毒品(亦写作narcotics，尤用于美国英语中)

value.def: If something, especially a drug, has a narcotic effect, it makes the person who uses it feel sleepy.

example.ex: ...hormones that have a narcotic effect on the immune system.
example.tran: 对免疫系统有麻醉作用的激素

value.tran: (尤指药物)麻醉的，致幻的，催眠的

partsOfSpeech.dec: narc 麻木 + ose 多…的 → 麻木的 → 昏迷的
narc 麻木 + osis 表疾病 → 昏迷状态，麻醉
narco 麻木 + therapy 治疗 → 麻醉疗法
narco 麻木 + tic 有…性质的，属于…的，具有…的 → 麻醉的

rootsaffixes.indicate: 表形容词，“患…病的，关于…的，有…性质的”
rootsaffixes.title: -otic

partsOfSpeech.dec: hypn 睡眠 + otic 患…病的，关于…的，有…性质的 → 催眠的
narc 麻木 + otic 患…病的，关于…的，有…性质的 → 麻醉的
zym 发酵 + otic 患…病的，关于…的，有…性质的 → 发酵的
